properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 1 at 9:52AM CDT expiring November 1 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
At 951 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from Heath to 6 miles northwest of Lockhart to 5 miles
north of Crestview, moving east at 40 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

Locations impacted include...
Andalusia, Opp, Florala, River Falls, Lockhart, Dozier, Heath and
Gantt.
properties.instruction:

building.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued November 1 at 10:52AM EDT expiring November 4 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
Black River At Elyria
Grand River At Painesville
The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Grand River At Painesville
* from late tonight to Sunday morning.
* At 9 AM the stage was 4.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late tonight and rise to near
10.3 feet by Friday afternoon. The river will fall below flood
stage by early Sunday morning.
* At 8.5 feet...Low land flooding adjacent to the river in the
metropark.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Never drive your car through flooded roadways. The water may be
deeper than it appears. Turn around...don't drown!

Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and other local media for further
details and updates.

properties.areaDesc: Sevier Smoky Mountains; Unicoi; Southeast Monroe; Cocke Smoky Mountains; Blount Smoky Mountains; Southeast Carter; Southeast Greene; Johnson
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 1 at 10:45AM EDT expiring November 2 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Morristown TN
properties.description:
A fast moving cold front will move across the area today
producing strong and gusty southwesterly winds. Southwest winds
will increase to 15 to 30 mph with gusts over 40 mph over the
higher elevations and adjacent foothills. The winds will subside
this evening into tonight.
* WINDS...South 15 to 30 mph with gusts over 40 mph.

* TIMING...Today and tonight.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree
limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that winds of 26 to 39 mph and/or gusts of
40 to 57 mph are expected or occurring. Winds this strong can
make driving difficult...especially for high profile vehicles.
Use extra caution.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT FRIDAY

Counties.

flood stage.
* Flood stage is 17.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.

properties.instruction:

properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 9:43AM CDT expiring November 1 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL out
20 NM...
Coastal waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS out 20 NM...
Pensacola Bay Area including Santa Rosa Sound...
Perdido Bay Area...
Waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 1115 AM CDT.

* At 942 AM CDT, strong thunderstorms capable of producing
waterspouts were located along a line extending from Escambia Bay
Bridge to near Perdido Pass to 21 nm south of Gulf Shores Beach to
29 nm south of Farewell Buoy, moving northeast at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Small craft could be damaged in briefly
higher winds and suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Arnica Bay, Lillian Bridge, Big Lagoon, Pensacola Beach, Pensacola
Pass, Fort Pickens, East Bay, Pensacola Bay Bridge, Garcon Point
Bridge and Perdido Pass.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 1 at 9:20AM CDT expiring November 1 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
South central Crenshaw County in south central Alabama...
Covington County in south central Alabama...
Northern Okaloosa County in northwestern Florida...

* Until 1000 AM CDT.

* At 919 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 11 miles southeast of Evergreen to 16 miles north of
Baker to 8 miles northeast of Roeville, moving east at 40 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Crestview, Andalusia, Opp, Florala, Baker, River Falls, Red Level,
Laurel Hill, Lockhart, Dozier, Heath and Gantt.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS out 20 NM; Waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL from 20 to 60 NM; Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL out 20 NM; Waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 9:14AM CDT expiring November 1 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL out
20 NM...
Coastal waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS out 20 NM...
Waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL from 20 to
60 NM...
Waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 1045 AM CDT.

* At 913 AM CDT, strong thunderstorms capable of producing
waterspouts and wind gusts to nearly 50 knots were located along a
line extending from 22 nm south of Farewell Buoy to 40 nm south of
Sand Island Lighthouse to 54 nm east of Pilottown, moving east at
45 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to nearly 50 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Small craft could be damaged in briefly
higher winds and suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Oriskany Reef.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 1 at 9:09AM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
At 909 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near West Blocton to near Talladega National
Forest to near Paul M Grist State Park to Selma to near Dallas Lake.
Movement was southeast at 40 mph.

Winds in excess of 40 mph will be possible with these storms.

Locations impacted include...
Selma, Calera, Clanton, Montevallo, Valley Grande, Centreville,
Jemison, Fort Deposit, Mosses, Hayneville, Selmont-West Selmont,
Thorsby, West Blocton, Autaugaville, White Hall, Maplesville, Wilton,
Gordonville, Billingsley and Lowndesboro.
properties.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 1 at 9:02AM CDT expiring November 1 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
Southeastern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama...
Southwestern Santa Rosa County in northwestern Florida...
Southeastern Escambia County in northwestern Florida...

* Until noon CDT.

* At 900 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in
the advisory area. Rates up to two inches an hour can be expected,
but generally less around 1.5 inches per hour.

At 845 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing waterspouts
was located 38 nm southeast of Chandeleur Sound, moving east at 25
knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats... damage
vessels and oil rigs... and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and wearing
life jackets. Waterspouts can become tornadoes if they move
onshore. Keep abreast of the situation. Expect wind gusts
in excess of 34 knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats
could sustain damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are
wearing life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

The severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

NWSheadline: A SPECIAL MARINE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued November 1 at 8:33AM CDT expiring November 5 at 4:27PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi TX
properties.description:
Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria County

.Recent or anticipated heavy rainfall over the aforementioned
river basins will result in river rises above flood stage
during the next few days.
The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a

* Flood Warning for the Guadalupe River At Victoria.
* from Friday afternoon to Monday afternoon...or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At 8:15 AM Thursday the stage was 14.6 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
* Forecast: Rise above flood stage by tomorrow early afternoon and
continue to rise to near 24.3 feet by Saturday evening. The river
will fall below flood stage by early Monday morning.
* At 24.0 feet Minor lowland flooding occurs. Water begins to flow
over River Road. Fox''s Bend in Riverside Park is inaccessible, and
the Riverside Boat Ramp parking area is affected by flood waters.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

All persons with interests along the river should monitor
the latest forecasts, and be prepared to take necessary
precautions to protect life and property. River stage forecasts
are based on observed and predicted rainfall. If actual
rainfall varies from forecast values, forecast river stages
will vary accordingly.

For the latest river stages and forecasts visit our AHPS page at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=crp

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued November 1 at 8:32AM CDT expiring November 2 at 1:20AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:

Counties
The Flood Warning continues for
The South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan.
* At 0745 AM Thursday the stage was 15.83 feet.
* Flood stage is 15 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river has crested and will continue to recede and
fall below flood stage by Thursday afternoon.
* At 15 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Do not drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Stay tuned to NOAA All Hazards Radio for the latest river forecasts.

properties.headline: Flood Watch issued November 1 at 9:26AM EDT expiring November 1 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
Low pressure over kentucky will push northeast through the Ohio
Valley...spreading rain across Central Indians today. The rain
could be heavy at times.
The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of central Indiana, south central Indiana, southeast
Indiana, and southwest Indiana, including the following areas,
in central Indiana, Bartholomew and Decatur. In south central
Indiana, Brown, Jackson, and Lawrence. In southeast Indiana,
Jennings. In southwest Indiana, Martin.

* Until 8 PM EDT this evening

* Widespread and at times heavy rain will persist across the
watch area through early this afternoon as low pressure tracks
into the Ohio Valley. As the low pulls away to the northeast
late today into tonight...rain will become more scattered.

* A storm total near 3 inches is expected across the watch area
in southeast portions of central Indiana by this evening with
locally higher amounts.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING

properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 8:17AM CDT expiring November 1 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island
Louisiana out 20 to 60 NM...
Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island out 20
NM...

* Until 900 AM CDT.

* At 817 AM CDT, a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing
waterspouts was located 24 nm south of Petit Bois Pass, moving
east at 30 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* The severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 1 at 8:06AM CDT expiring November 2 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
* WHERE...The Gulf beaches of Alabama and the western Florida
Panhandle.

* SURF HEIGHTS...Building to 5 to 8 feet.

* TIMING...Dangerous surf heights expected this morning through
this evening. A high risk of rip currents is in effect through
Friday morning.

* Impacts...Frequent life-threatening rip currents are expected.
The surf is dangerous for all levels of swimmers.
properties.instruction:
There is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents are life-
threatening to anyone entering the surf. Swim near a lifeguard.
If caught in a rip current remain calm. Don't fight the current.
Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape,
face the shore and call or wave for help. If tired, float or
tread water until out of the rip current.

A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and
dangerous swimming conditions.

properties.description:

extensive high clouds move out of the area. Freezing conditions
are still expected early this morning.
* TEMPERATURES AND TIMING...Temperatures will fall into the
upper 20s to lower 30s over the foothills of the Gila Region
by dawn Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...Sensitive vegetation may be damaged or killed.
Temperatures may be dangerous for animals left outdoors.
properties.instruction:
A Freeze Warning means sub-freezing temperatures are imminent or
highly likely. These conditions will kill crops and other
sensitive vegetation. Bring pets indoors.

and protect yourself from flying debris.

properties.description:

coastal waters this morning. A modest northerly flow and
decreasing seas are expected in the wake of the front.

knots by late morning.

late this afternoon.
properties.instruction:

are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels should avoid navigating in these conditions.

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 1 at 7:19AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Strong north winds behind a cold front will continue through late
this morning. Peak wind gusts from 30 to 40 mph were observed in
southeast Missouri overnight. These gusty winds will overspread
southern Illinois and southwest Indiana this morning.

A few trees have been blown down in southeast Missouri due to the
combination of gusty winds and saturated soil. Similar impacts are
possible in southern Illinois and southwest Indiana.

Exercise caution if you are outdoors this morning. Watch for loose
debris on roadways.

NWSheadline: Strong and gusty winds in southern Illinois and southwest Indiana this morning

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 7:18AM CDT expiring November 1 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
At 717 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located near Downtown Mobile, moving northeast at 50 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
central Mobile and western Baldwin Counties.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

properties.headline: Flood Watch issued November 1 at 7:06AM CDT expiring November 1 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of southeast Illinois, western Kentucky, and all of
southwest Indiana. In southern Illinois, the watch continues to
include Gallatin, Hardin, and White Counties. In western
Kentucky, Caldwell, Christian, Crittenden, Daviess, Henderson,
Hopkins, Lyon, McLean, Muhlenberg, Todd, Trigg, Union, and
Webster Counties remain in the watch.

* Until 1 PM CDT this afternoon

* Widespread heavy rain will taper off to light showers from
southwest to northeast later this morning. Storm total rainfall
in the watch area is forecast to range from 2 to 4 inches, with
isolated amounts to 5 inches in northwest Kentucky.

* Localized flooding of low lying and flood-prone areas is
likely, as well as urban street flooding. Flood Warnings are
already in effect for some areas. Falling leaves may also clog
drainage systems and impede the normal course of water runoff.
In addition, expect some river flooding later this week into
early next week.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should keep monitoring updated forecasts and be alert for
Flood Warnings. Be prepared to take action should flooding occur.

properties.areaDesc: Chandeleur Sound; Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island out 20 NM; Mississippi Sound
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 7:00AM CDT expiring November 1 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Chandeleur Sound...
Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island out 20
NM...
Mississippi Sound...

* Until 730 AM CDT.

* At 659 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located near Horn Island, moving east at 45 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
Chandeleur Sound, Horn Island and Pascagoula.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.

developed across parts of the Coastal Plain, Piedmont and southern
portions of the Triangle and Triad area. A few locations may have
visibilities on the order of a few hundred feet. Visibilities
should notably improve by mid morning.

Drivers are urged to slow down, use low beam headlights, and
leave plenty of following distance between vehicles. Be on the
lookout for sudden changes in visibility. Visibility can drop
quickly over short distances, especially near rivers, lakes and
other low-lying areas.

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 6:48AM CDT expiring November 1 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Southeastern Jackson County in southern Mississippi...

* Until 715 AM CDT.

* At 648 AM CDT, a tornado producing storm was located near Helena,
or near Escatawpa, moving east at 55 mph.

HAZARD...Damaging tornado.

SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
southeastern Jackson County.
properties.instruction:
To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an
interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid
windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move
to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying
debris.

To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency.
They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in
New Orleans.

CMAMtext: Tornado Warning in this area til 7:15 AM CDT. Take shelter now. Check local media. -NWS

properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 6:26AM CDT expiring November 1 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Breton Sound...
Chandeleur Sound...
Coastal Waters from Boothville LA to Southwest Pass of the
Mississippi River out 20 nm...
Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island out 20
NM...

* Until 715 AM CDT.

* At 626 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing
waterspouts were located along a line extending from 16 nm east of
Yscloskey to 15 nm northeast of Barataria Bay, moving east at 35
knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
Breton Sound and Chandeleur Sound.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

building.

To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service
office in New Orleans.

South Sulphur River Near Cooper Affecting Delta and Hopkins
Counties
The Flood Warning continues for
The South Sulphur River Near Cooper.
* At 0615 AM Thursday the stage was 21.85 feet.
* Flood stage is 16 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to a crest near 22 feet
by Thursday morning then begin falling but remain above flood
stage.
properties.instruction:

Stay tuned to NOAA All Hazards Radio for the latest river forecasts.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued November 1 at 6:22AM CDT expiring November 3 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
Ouachita River At Arkadelphia affecting Clark and Hot Spring
Counties


River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall
forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of
flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall
forecasts.

Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our
Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at...
www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Ouachita River At Arkadelphia.
* from this afternoon to Saturday evening...or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At  5:00 AM Thursday the stage was 12.1 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 17.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this
afternoon due to releases from Remmel Dam. The flooding will be minor and
brief, with the river cresting around 19.5 feet late tonight. The river
is expected to fall back below flood stage during the day Friday.
* Impacts at 19.0 feet...State Highway 7 and 51 railroad underpass
flooded. Fields and timber along the river flooded.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Safety message...Remember to Turn Around...Don't Drown
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.

Everyone with property or other interest along streams and rivers
should remain alert to changing weather forecasts. Should conditions
change...Look for river forecasts or Flood Warnings for use in making
informed decisions to protect life and property.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued November 1 at 6:18AM CDT expiring November 1 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Paducah has extended the

* Flood Warning for Urban Areas and Small Streams in...
Calloway County in western Kentucky...

* Until 830 AM CDT.

* At 614 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain moving
east across the county that will cause flooding. One area is
moving east across the northern half of the county where up to two
inches of rain has already fallen. Another area of very heavy rain
is in the southeasternmost part of the county. Both areas of rain
will move east out of the county in the next hour or so but may
drop another one half to one inch of rain before tapering off.
Only light rain is expected after that allowing any ongoing
flooding to subside.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Murray, Hazel, Kirksey, Harris Grove, New Concord and Crossland.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles. Please report flooding to your local law
enforcement agency when you can do so safely.

properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into a
small central room in a sturdy structure.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency.
They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in
New Orleans.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

Crandall around 630 AM CDT.

properties.instruction:

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 6:12AM CDT expiring November 1 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
At 611 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located 12 miles north of Latimer, or 16 miles north of St.
Martin, moving northeast at 50 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
northwestern Jackson County.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile
home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and
protect yourself from flying debris.

Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not
wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the
National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency
who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the
path of dangerous weather.

properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 1 at 3:12AM AKDT expiring November 1 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Chance of Freezing
Rain. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected.
Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches expected.

* WHERE...Point Lay west.

* WHEN...Until noon today.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 55 mph will
cause areas of blowing and drifting snow reducing the
visibility to one half mile or less at times.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be
obtained by calling 5 1 1.

properties.areaDesc: Chandeleur Sound; Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island out 20 NM; Mississippi Sound
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 6:06AM CDT expiring November 1 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Chandeleur Sound...
Coastal waters from Pascagoula Mississippi to Stake Island out 20
NM...
Mississippi Sound...

* Until 700 AM CDT.

* At 606 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 7 nm north of Cat Island, moving east at 35
knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
Ship Island, Cat Island, Mississippi Sound, Horn Island and
Pascagoula.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

Fourchon, or 21 miles southeast of Galliano, moving northeast at

shore quickly.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Grand Isle.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

If on or near marine areas, get away from the water and move indoors
or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles
from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close
enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now!  Do not
be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 5:51AM CDT expiring November 1 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
For the following areas...
Coastal Waters from Port Fourchon LA to Lower Atchafalaya River LA
out 20 nm...
Coastal waters from Port Fourchon Louisiana to Lower Atchafalaya
River LA from 20 to 60 NM...

At 551 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing waterspouts
was located 18 nm south of Isle Derniers, moving southeast at 25
knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts in excess of 50 knots.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats... damage
vessels and oil rigs... and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and wearing
life jackets. Waterspouts can become tornadoes if they move
onshore. Keep abreast of the situation. Expect wind gusts
in excess of 65 knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats
could sustain catastrophic damage or capsize. Make sure all
on board are wearing life jackets. Return to safe harbor if
possible

Locations impacted include...
Timbalier Bay, Terrebonne Bay and Timbalier Island.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

moving northeast at 40 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.

damage is likely.

properties.instruction:

mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

properties.instruction:

from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the

building.

To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service
office in New Orleans.

a line extending from Fairview to near New Salem to near Columbus
AFB. Movement was east at 45 mph.

Locations impacted include...

Beaverton, Weston, Blooming Grove, Lamar County Airport, Crews,

properties.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms.
Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe
shelter inside a building or vehicle.

These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms have a history of
producing wind damage across portions of Louisiana. SEEK SHELTER NOW
inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! To report
severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They
will send your report to the National Weather Service office in New
Orleans.

properties.description:

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Central Jones County in southeastern Mississippi...

heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is anticipated
to begin shortly.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Laurel, Ellisville, Sandersville, Tuckers Crossing and Soso.
properties.instruction:

deaths occur in vehicles.

creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 5:25AM CDT expiring November 1 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Chandeleur Sound...
Lake Borgne...
Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas...
Mississippi Sound...

* Until 615 AM CDT.

* At 524 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located near Rigolets, moving east at 35 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to nearly 50 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
Lake Borgne and Rigolets.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 1 at 5:22AM CDT by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
Patchy dense fog continues this morning across parts of central
into southeast North Dakota. The worst conditions have been in the
James River Valley, especially along Interstate 94 in Stutsman
County. Visibility has been reduced to one quarter mile at
Jamestown for the last several hours. Expect conditions to improve
after 8 AM CDT.

Motorists, including those on Interstate 94 between Bismarck and
Jamestown, should be prepared for rapidly changing conditions
with visibility being reduced to a quarter mile at times. Slow
down and use your low beam headlights. Be especially cautious at
railroad crossings and uncontrolled intersections.

Temperatures across the area remain below freezing. The fog may
deposit a thin layer of ice on elevated surfaces. Be alert for
slick spots, especially on bridges.

NWSheadline: PATCHY DENSE FOG FROM CENTRAL TO SOUTHEAST NORTH DAKOTA THIS MORNING

properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued November 1 at 6:21AM EDT expiring November 3 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
properties.description:
A brief period of 6 ft seas will be possible this morning across
the outer central and southern waters. South to southwest winds
increase to 15 to 25 knots late today and tonight ahead of an
approaching cold front. Seas will build to 5 to 8 feet tonight.
Winds will continue to increase Friday into Friday night to 20 to
30 knots with seas building to 7 to 10 feet. Winds Saturday will
shift to west northwest and diminish to 10 to 15 knots late. Seas
are forecast to subside below 6 feet Saturday evening.
* WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 kt with gusts up to 30 kt.

* WAVES...2 to 4 feet.
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory means that wind speeds of 25 to 33 knots
and/or seas of 6 feet or greater are expected to produce
hazardous wave conditions to small craft. Inexperienced mariners,
especially those operating smaller vessels should avoid
navigating in these conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM EDT SATURDAY

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 5:12AM CDT expiring November 1 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
East central Pearl River County in southern Mississippi...

* Until 545 AM CDT.

* At 512 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located 9 miles southeast of Poplarville, moving northeast at
45 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
east central Pearl River County.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile
home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and
protect yourself from flying debris.

Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not
wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency.
They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in
New Orleans.

CMAMtext: Tornado Warning in this area til 5:45 AM CDT. Take shelter now. Check local media. -NWS

properties.description:

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal Waters from Port Fourchon LA to Lower Atchafalaya River LA
out 20 nm...
Coastal waters from Port Fourchon Louisiana to Lower Atchafalaya
River LA from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 615 AM CDT.

* At 509 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 14 nm northeast of Eugene Island 189, or 17
nm southwest of Caillou Bay, moving southeast at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and dangerouis wind gusts in excess of 50
knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 65
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
catastrophic damage or capsize. Make sure all on board
are wearing life jackets. Return to safe harbor if
possible

* Locations impacted include...
Timbalier Bay, Caillou Bay, Terrebonne Bay, Isle Derniers and
Timbalier Island.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.event: Small Craft Advisory for Hazardous Seas
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory for Hazardous Seas issued November 1 at 3:07AM PDT expiring November 2 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a Small Craft
Advisory for hazardous seas, which is in effect from 11 PM this
evening to 4 PM PDT Friday.

* WINDS...Southwest wind 15 to 20 kt with gusts to 25 kt late this
afternoon, becoming south 20 to 25 kt with gusts to 30 kt after
midnight. Then west winds 10 to 20 kt with gusts to 25 kt Friday
morning.

* SEAS...West swell 6 to 8 feet today building to around 10 feet
tonight. Seas will subside below 9 feet late Friday night.
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory for wind means that wind speeds of 21 to
33 knots are expected. Inexperienced mariners, especially those
operating smaller vessels should avoid navigating in these
conditions.

A Small Craft Advisory for hazardous seas means that waves are
expected to be hazardous to small craft. Mariners should avoid
shoaling areas. Long period swell can sharpen into large breaking
waves in shoaling areas. It is not unusual for waves to break
much farther from shoaling areas than is normally experienced.
Remember, breaking waves can easily capsize even larger vessels.

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 1 at 5:06AM CDT by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
Patchy dense fog continues across the James River Valley this
morning, especially along Interstate 94 in Stutsman County.
Visibility has been reduced to one quarter mile at Jamestown for
the last several hours. Expect conditions to improve after 8 AM
CDT.

If driving, be prepared for rapidly changing conditions with
visibility being reduced to a quarter mile at times. Slow down and
use your low beam headlights. Be especially cautious at railroad
crossings and uncontrolled intersections.

Temperatures across the area remain below freezing. The fog may
deposit a thin layer of ice on elevated surfaces. Be alert for
slick spots, especially on bridges.

NWSheadline: PATCHY DENSE FOG OVER THE JAMES RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING

properties.description:

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

Locations impacted include...
Tupelo, Verona, Trace State Park, Tombigbee State Park, Saltillo,
Shannon, Plantersville, Troy, Furrs, Sherman, Beech Springs, Skyline,
Endville, Belden, Chiwapa, Palmetto, Eggville, Bissell, Chesterville
and Frog Island.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread
significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately
likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of
a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant
property damage.

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 4:59AM CDT expiring November 1 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
At 459 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located over Forest, moving northeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
southeastern Scott County, including the following locations... Lake.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT COUNTY

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 4:55AM CDT expiring November 1 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Northeastern Chickasaw County in northeastern Mississippi...
Southeastern Pontotoc County in northeastern Mississippi...

* Until 515 AM CDT.

* At 454 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated severe thunderstorms
producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage
were located near Houlka, or 9 miles northwest of Okolona, moving
northeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
northeastern Chickasaw and southeastern Pontotoc Counties.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the
lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are
outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest
substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.

Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not
wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

CMAMtext: Tornado Warning in this area til 5:15 AM CDT. Take shelter now. Check local media. -NWS

properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 4:50AM CDT expiring November 1 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Lake Borgne...
Mississippi Sound...

* Until 500 AM CDT.

* At 449 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located near Rigolets, moving northeast at 50
knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
Rigolets.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor until hazardous weather passes.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

Wind Watch, which is in effect from late tonight through Friday
evening.

* WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph.

* TIMING...Winds will strengthen along the Northern Rocky Mountain
Front late tonight. High winds then spread further south Friday
morning, and onto the adjacent plains through Friday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult in cross winds, especially
for high profile vehicles.
properties.instruction:
A High Wind Watch means there is the potential for a hazardous
high wind event. Sustained winds of at least 40 mph, or gusts of
58 mph or stronger, may occur. Continue to monitor the latest
forecasts.

properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a Small Craft
Advisory...which is in effect from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM
PDT Friday. A Gale Watch has also been issued. This Gale Watch is
in effect from late tonight through Friday afternoon.

* WIND...Westerly 15 to 25 kt tonight, possibly rising to 25 to 35
kt Friday.
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory means that wind speeds of 21 to 33 knots
are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels should avoid navigating in these conditions.

A Gale Watch is issued when the risk of gale force winds of 34 to
47 knots has significantly increased, but the specific timing
and/or location is still uncertain. It is intended to provide
additional lead time for mariners who may wish to consider
altering their plans.

properties.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 1 at 3:35AM MDT by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A cold front will move through the area around midday. Northwest
winds will increase to 20 to 30 mph, with gusts to around 40 mph.
Winds will diminish after sunset. The gusty winds will suspend fine
dust in the air over west Rapid City, producing poor air quality.

The Rapid City Air Quality Office recommends the elderly, young,
and anyone with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical
exertion and exposure to the outside air.

Voluntary actions to reduce dust pollution include, ceasing or
reducing the manipulation of soil in construction, industrial,
and agricultural activities, and increasing the use of pollution
controls for soil stabilization, waste pits, stock piles, and
construction sites.

NWSheadline: AIR POLLUTION ALERT FOR DUST FOR RAPID CITY WEST OF THE GAP IN EFFECT FROM NOON UNTIL 700 PM

floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

CMAMtext: Tornado Warning in this area til 5:15 AM CDT. Take shelter now. Check local media. -NWS

properties.areaDesc: Pearl River, MS; St. Tammany, LA
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 1 at 4:27AM CDT expiring November 1 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Central St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana...
Southwestern Pearl River County in southern Mississippi...

* Until 500 AM CDT.

* At 427 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located 8 miles east of Abita Springs, or 12 miles west of
Picayune, moving northeast at 25 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This dangerous storm will be near...
Picayune around 500 AM CDT.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile
home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and
protect yourself from flying debris.

Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not
wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency.
They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in
New Orleans.

CMAMtext: Tornado Warning in this area til 5:00 AM CDT. Take shelter now. Check local media. -NWS

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Severe thunderstorms will be near...
Eupora and Reform around 440 AM CDT.
Sherwood around 445 AM CDT.
Mathiston around 450 AM CDT.
Maben and Clarkson around 455 AM CDT.
Cumberland around 500 AM CDT.

properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread
significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately
likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of
a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant
property damage.

properties.areaDesc: Lake Borgne; Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued November 1 at 4:24AM CDT expiring November 1 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Lake Borgne...
Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas...

* Until 530 AM CDT.

* At 423 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located near Manchac, moving east at 30 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 40 to 50 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
The Mid Point Of The Causeway Bridge, Lake Pontchartrain/Lake
Maurepas, Mandeville, Eden Isle and Kenner.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued November 1 at 3:20AM MDT expiring November 3 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a High Wind
Warning, which is in effect from 3 AM Friday to 3 AM MDT
Saturday.

* TIMING...3 AM Friday through 3 AM Saturday.

* WINDS...West winds 35 to 45 MPH sustained with gusts to 65 MPH
possible.

* IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Light weight and high
profile vehicles such as campers, light load semi trucks, and
recreation vehicles will be susceptible to blow offs or
blowovers.
properties.instruction:
A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected
or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts
of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM FRIDAY TO 3 AM MDT SATURDAY

properties.areaDesc: Waters from Lower Atchafalaya River to Intracoastal City LA from 20 to 60 NM; Waters from Intracoastal City to Cameron LA from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued November 1 at 4:14AM CDT expiring November 1 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles LA
properties.description:
Strong and gusty south winds along with rough seas will persist
ahead of a cold front front pushing through the coastal waters
this morning. A modest northerly flow and decreasing seas are
expected in the wake of the front.
* WINDS...South to southwest winds 20 to 25 knots with gusts to
near Gale force early this morning. Winds becoming northwest 15
to 20 knots by late morning.


* WAVES/SEAS...7 to 9 feet gradually subsiding to around 6 feet
late this afternoon.
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory means that wind speeds of 21 to 33 knots
are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels should avoid navigating in these conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
